text: getting this error in HubSpot app settings -> URL is not in the list of stored URLs in the App Settings. Please contact HubSpot.

Hi All
I have used the file upload property in a form.
How to show (Get a signed URL for a private file) image on the page?

Hi everyone!
I have a quick question, our app is installed on multiple organizations and we also have created CRM cards in our application. Actually, we want to control these CRM cards to enable only on specific organizations, is it possible to control these cards via API to enable/disable them based on some specific organizations?
Has anyone tried storing data from HubSpot into Big query?
Oh I'm very interested in this! cc <@U0336QCR2FQ> and <@U03K29A62HG>
What would be the main application for this?

HubSpot sneakily allowed you to use the Google APIs package, so I wonder if that can hit Big Query

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
It definitely should be able to, and if not you can just use axios or fetch
fwiw this is a classic ETL use case: <https://airbyte.com/connections/HubSpot-to-BigQuery>

<@U03K29A62HG> I have looked into airbyte, I have had success uploading the data to big query, but only the streams that have available API and the data I am interested in are campaigns that are not email campaigns.

Also, the way HubSpot data is structured seems like a nightmare for me. The columns are dates in string format and the campaigns are rows. I do not know how to convert each column to datetime using big query. In PowerBi I am able to transpose and clean the data efficiently. FYI  I am new to HubSpot and also trying to visualize data outside of HubSpot.
The datetime fields are in epoc milliseconds format, just fyi
